job_title: Adjunct Online Instructor in Birmingham, AL
pros: A terrific little school. They had a great heritage but ran out of time and money. A wonderful place full of great people. I miss them greatly.
cons: They were a women's only college in a small town. (The online school was open to both men and women.) They just weren't able to attract enough students to the physical school. The online school was growing, but ran out of time. Unfortunately, this is not the first private college to close and won't be the last.

review_title: This is a wonderful college that provides a great education in a Christian atmosphere
pros:
Judson provides classes, excellent price for a private college, safe campus, rural area with few distractions, caring staff, traditions that go back many generations and unite alumnae.  
Working there provided me with many opportunities to be creative and to grow professionally.  You get to work with students at every stage of development.  You get to know them, and they get to know you.  You will remember them when they are gone, and some will become your dearest friends over the years.
cons: The College worked hard to keep costs down.  Of course, that meant that we sometimes were not compensated as well we might have been at other colleges, but the administration works hard to keep up.  You have to believe in the mission, and truly love working with students.  But, that isn't a con, is it?

review_title: Judson provides a fun, interactive, challenging environment with the goal of building and encouraging.
pros: It is a fun, exciting, ever changing environment. Judson College is constantly presenting students and staff with new and different experiences. It is a very welcoming environment. This school is one of the few schools, if not the only school, that has constant interaction between past, present, and future students.
cons: Honestly, for me there were no real downsides. I greatly enjoyed my time at Judson. I suppose one con could be that there are those on staff and around campus who are not open to new ideas so there are some areas that are sort of locked in and not really open for changing. This can sometimes have a negative affect on things at Judson but not generally.

pros: There is wonderful collegiality at the college. We all seemed to get along well. Students were bright and classroom atmosphere was good.
cons: Teachers are highly expendable. Few have tenure, so if the president wants you gone, you're gone quickly with no recourse. Trustees don't have a clue what the administration is doing or how money is spent. One former colleague remarked that most everyone seems to leave mad. This is regrettable. The college is always struggling financially and location is not desirable. It's unsure what the future holds for the institution.
